Key Match Events: Anthony Davis had 31 points and 14 rebounds.
LeBron James highlighted a 21-point performance with a pair of pivotal 3-pointers in the final minutes.
Rookie Dalton Knecht hit five 3s to finish with a career-high 27 points in a spot start for the Lakers.
Brandon Ingram scored 32 points, and reserve Jaylen Nowell scored 16 points for the Pelicans.
Right after a clutch 3 by Ingram gave the Pelicans a late two-point lead, James responded with consecutive 3s to put the Lakers up 101-97 with 37 seconds left.
The Lakers outscored the Pelicans in the paint, 52-40.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Lakers extended their winning streak to five games with a 104-99 victory over the New Orleans Pelicans.
LeBron James' career-long four-game triple-double streak came to an end.
Despite having just 10 players in uniform, the Pelicans led 56-46 at halftime but couldn’t quite get the win.
